item.title: Harriet Tubman National Historical Park and Harriet Tubman Underground Railroad National Historical Park Act

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. (text of measure as introduced: CR S7927-7929)

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests and Public Lands.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

item.name: Civil Rights and Liberties, Minority Issues

summary.text:
Harriet Tubman National Historical Park and Harriet Tubman Underground Railroad National Historical Park Act - Establishes in the City of Auburn, New York, the Harriet Tubman National Historical Park as a unit of the National Park System.

Establishes in Caroline, Dorchester, and Talbot Counties, Maryland, the Harriet Tubman Underground Railroad National Historical Park as a unit of the National Park System.

Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to provide grant funding and enter into cooperative agreements with certain entities for the historic preservation, rehabilitation, interpretation, and maintenance of such historical parks. Requires the Secretary to complete a general management plan for them.

bill.title: Harriet Tubman National Historical Park and Harriet Tubman Underground Railroad National Historical Park Act

item.title: Harriet Tubman National Historical Park and Harriet Tubman Underground Railroad National Historical Park Act
Harriet Tubman National Historical Park and Harriet Tubman Underground Railroad National Historical Park Act

To establish the Harriet Tubman National Historical Park in Auburn, New York, and the Harriet Tubman Underground Railroad National Historical Park in Caroline, Dorchester, and Talbot Counties, Maryland, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests and Public Lands.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
